query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Poi che la carità del natio loco 2 mi strinse, raunai le fronde sparte 3 e rende’le a colui, ch’era già fioco.
query.error: **English:** 1 After the love of my native place 2 gripped me, I gathered the scattered branches 3 and returned them to him who was already weak.
query.result: 1 Wosa karita an cita genys 2 a wrug owth strivya an fronjow sparth 3 ha'gas owth dhe'n, o oas owth fiok.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Indi venimmo al fine ove si parte 5 lo secondo giron dal terzo, e dove 6 si vede di giustizia orribil arte.
query.error: **English:** 4 Then we came to the end where the 5 second circle departs from the third, and where 6 one sees the horrible art of justice.
query.result: 4 Wosa henna ny vynnas dhe'n fin orth le mayth 5 an nessa giron a-dhia an tres, ha le mayth 6 y hwel gwelys an arta orth justys orthribil.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 A ben manifestar le cose nove, 8 dico che arrivammo ad una landa 9 che dal suo letto ogne pianta rimove.
query.error: **English:** 7 To clearly show the new things, 8 I say that we arrived at a plain 9 that removes every plant from its bed.
query.result: 7 Rag kler dhiskwedhes an traow nowyth, 8 y lavaraf ny vynnas dhe'n tir 9 a remov pub planys a'y gwely.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 La dolorosa selva l’è ghirlanda 11 intorno, come ’l fosso tristo ad essa; 12 quivi fermammo i passi a randa a randa.
query.error: **English:** 10 The sorrowful forest is a garland 11 around it, as is the sad moat to it; 12 there we stopped our steps, side by side.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Lo spazzo era una rena arida e spessa, 14 non d’altra foggia fatta che colei 15 che fu da’ piè di Caton già soppressa.
query.error: **English:** 13 The ground was a dry and thick sand, 14 made in no other way than that 15 which was once trampled underfoot by Cato.
query.result: 13 An spas o oas rena sych ha tewl, 14 heb formyans erel nebmes orth henna 15 a veu gwaskys gans traesow Katen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 O vendetta di Dio, quanto tu dei 17 esser temuta da ciascun che legge 18 ciò che fu manifesto a li occhi mei!
query.error: **English:** 16 O vengeance of God, how much you ought to be 17 feared by everyone who reads 18 what was revealed to my eyes!
query.result: 16 O venjans orth Duw, pyth eus owth dhe'vys 17 bos dhe'dh ofn gans pubonan a wra'gas lejy 18 henna a veu kler dhe'm lyga'sow!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 D’anime nude vidi molte gregge 20 che piangean tutte assai miseramente, 21 e parea posta lor diversa legge.
query.error: **English:** 19 I saw many herds of naked souls 20 who were all weeping very miserably, 21 and it seemed that different laws had been set for them.
query.result: 19 A welas bagas a enewegow noeth 20 a oas owth gul owth pubonan orth orth miserabel, 21 ha'gas owth semlas lejy erel dhe'n.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Supin giacea in terra alcuna gente, 23 alcuna si sedea tutta raccolta, 24 e altra andava continüamente.
query.error: **English:** 22 Some people were lying supine on the ground, 23 some were sitting all huddled up, 24 and others were walking continuously.
query.result: 22 Supin o oas koweth orth an tir nebes dus, 23 nebes erel owth sedea pubonan orth kollet, 24 ha erel owth koesas orth orth kontinuys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Quella che giva ’ntorno era più molta, 26 e quella men che giacëa al tormento, 27 ma più al duolo avea la lingua sciolta.
query.error: **English:** 25 She who went around was more numerous, 26 and she who lay in torment was less, 27 but she had her tongue more loosened to grief.
query.result: 25 Hi a wra dheuth ogas oos moy, 26 ha hi a wra le ages yn an poen, 27 mes moy oos hi a wra dheuth dhe goel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Sovra tutto ’l sabbion, d’un cader lento, 29 piovean di foco dilatate falde, 30 come di neve in alpe sanza vento.
query.error: **English:** 28 Over all the sand, with a slow fall, 29 dilated flakes of fire were raining down, 30 like snow in the Alps without wind.
query.result: 28 A-ugh an chi fowt, gans kodha lent, 29 oos faljyon tan ow tewlel aga, 30 kepar ergh yn Alpen heb gwyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Quali Alessandro in quelle parti calde 32 d’Indïa vide sopra ’l süo stuolo 33 fiamme cadere infino a terra salde,
query.error: **English:** 31 Like Alexander in those hot regions 32 of India saw above his army 33 flames falling steadily to the ground,
query.result: 31 Kepar Aleksander ynwedn hyn rannvroow tomm 32 yn Eynda a welas war-barth y gerlys 33 flamys ow fethens dhe-ves dhe'n dor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 per ch’ei provide a scalpitar lo suolo 35 con le sue schiere, acciò che lo vapore 36 mei si stingueva mentre ch’era solo:
query.error: **English:** 34 so he ordered his troops to stamp on the ground, 35 so that the vapor would be extinguished while it was still alone:
query.result: 34 Rag wosa ev a leveris y werin 35 dhe'n stampya an dor, rag an ayr a via 36 ow tynnergh pub onan pan o ev a-huni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 tale scendeva l’etternale ardore; 38 onde la rena s’accendea, com’ esca 39 sotto focile, a doppiar lo dolore.
query.error: **English:** 37 in such a way the eternal fire was descending; 38 so the sand was ignited, like tinder 39 under a flint, doubling the pain.
query.result: 37 Ynwedn hyn an tannow an tannow a-dheuth 38 ha'n dowr a via ow tannvos kepar losow 39 a-woles war-barth tanow, ow dowbla an poen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Sanza riposo mai era la tresca 41 de le misere mani, or quindi or quinci 42 escotendo da sé l’arsura fresca.
query.error: **English:** 40 Without rest, the wretched hands 41 were always shaking off the fresh burning, 42 now here, now there.
query.result: 40 Heb posegyans, an tres o'n dhewynnow 41 a'n dhewynnow truan, ow tos ha'n dre 42 ow skwya an gwresow nowydh a-woles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 43 I began: "Master, you who conquer 44 all things, except for those stubborn demons 45 who came out to meet us at the entrance to the gate,
query.result: 43 Me a dhallathas: "Mestron, ty a wra 44 oll an traow, mes an demonyon kales 45 a dheuth dhe'n fordh dhe'n porth dhe'n hon wra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 chi è quel grande che non par che curi 47 lo ’ncendio e giace dispettoso e torto, 48 sì che la pioggia non par che ’l marturi?».
query.error: **English:** 46 who is that great one who doesn't seem to care 47 about the fire and lies scornful and twisted, 48 so that the rain doesn't seem to bother him?"
query.result: 46 Piu ha'n brassa onan na wra gweles 47 an tannow ha'n kov dhe-ves ha'n gamm, 48 marnas an glaw na wra gweles ev a-woles?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 E quel medesmo, che si fu accorto 50 ch’io domandava il mio duca di lui, 51 gridò: «Qual io fui vivo, tal son morto.
query.error: **English:** 49 And that same one, who had noticed 50 that I was asking my guide about him, 51 shouted: "As I was in life, so I am in death.
query.result: 49 Ha'n huni, ow tos ow komprehendya 50 ow kovyn vy an Arlodh a-droytho, 51 a leveris: "Kepar ow kov vy byw, vy marow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Se Giove stanchi ’l suo fabbro da cui 53 crucciato prese la folgore aguta 54 onde l’ultimo dì percosso fui;
query.error: **English:** 52 If Jove tires his blacksmith from whom, 53 in anger, he took the sharp thunderbolt 54 with which I was struck on my last day;
query.result: 52 Mar Joab a wra blonek y'n kov herwydh 53 ow kemer an folgor owth dhe-ves, 54 owth ow kov vy daras dhe'n jorna diwettha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Dio in disdegno, e poco par che ’l pregi; 71 ma, com’ io dissi lui, li suoi dispetti 72 sono al suo petto assai debiti fregi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Or mi vien dietro, e guarda che non metti, 74 ancor, li piedi ne la rena arsiccia; 75 ma sempre al bosco tien li piedi stretti».
query.error: **English:** 73 Now come behind me, and take care not to put 74 your feet in the burning sand; 75 but keep your feet always close to the wood."
query.result: 73 Wosa vyth, ha gwel na wra tus, 74 an treys dhe'n avon tan, 75 mes dhe'n koed gwith an treys dhe'n glus."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Tacendo divenimmo là ’ve spiccia 77 fuor de la selva un picciol fiumicello, 78 lo cui rossore ancor mi raccapriccia.
query.error: **English:** 76 In silence we came to where a little stream 77 gushes forth from the forest, 78 whose redness still makes me shudder.
query.result: 76 Yn taws, deuthon dhe'n le, le mayth 77 avon byghan a-dhyworth an koedh, 78 hag y rudhder a wra'm ow th'aga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Quale del Bulicame esce ruscello 80 che parton poi tra lor le peccatrici, 81 tal per la rena giù sen giva quello.

query.result: 79 Kepar avon a dheuth dhyworth an Bulicame, 80 a wra perthys lemmyn an pechatowrys, 81 kepar henna a'n jeva a-hedh dhyworth an avon.

query.error: **English:** 91 These words came from my leader; 92 because of which I begged him to grant me the food 93 for which he had given me the desire.
query.result: 91 An gerow ma a veu leverys gans an dygh, 92 rag wosa henna y’m pythvos dhe dhysplegya an boes 93 a veu leverys gans an dygh an gows.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 «In mezzo mar siede un paese guasto», 95 diss’ elli allora, «che s’appella Creta, 96 sotto ’l cui rege fu già ’l mondo casto.
query.error: **English:** 94 "In the middle of the sea sits a ruined land," 95 he said then, "which is called Crete, 96 under whose king the world was once pure.
query.result: 94 "Y'n kres an mor yma bys trevesys," 95 leveris ef ena, "henwysys Kreta, 96 danvon an myghtern na veu an bys pudh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Una montagna v’è che già fu lieta 98 d’acqua e di fronde, che si chiamò Ida; 99 or è diserta come cosa vieta.
query.error: **English:** 97 There is a mountain that once was joyful 98 with water and leaves, which was called Ida; 99 now it is deserted like something old and worn out.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Rëa la scelse già per cuna fida 101 del suo figliuolo, e per celarlo meglio, 102 quando piangea, vi facea far le grida.
query.error: **English:** 100 Rhea chose it as a safe cradle 101 for her son, and to better conceal him, 102 when he cried, she made them make a loud noise.
query.result: 100 Rëa a'y dewsyas avel rag fidys 101 rag y flogh, ha'gas gwella y gelwel, 102 pan oedh ow wewla, hi a wra gwruthyl an gri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Dentro dal monte sta dritto un gran veglio, 104 che tien volte le spalle inver’ Dammiata 105 e Roma guarda come süo speglio.
query.error: **English:** 103 Within the mountain stands upright a great old man, 104 who turns his back ten times towards Damietta 105 and looks at Rome as if it were his mirror.
query.result: 103 Mes a-berth an menydh yma sevel unn coth bras, 104 hag degweyth y gila orth Damyata 105 ha gul Roma avel y spygol.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 La sua testa è di fin oro formata, 107 e puro argento son le braccia e ’l petto, 108 poi è di rame infino a la forcata;
query.error: **English:** 106 His head is formed of fine gold, 107 and pure silver are his arms and chest, 108 then he is of bronze down to the fork;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 da indi in giuso è tutto ferro eletto, 110 salvo che ’l destro piede è terra cotta; 111 e sta ’n su quel, più che ’n su l’altro, eretto.
query.error: **English:** 109 from there downwards he is all of fine iron, 110 except that his right foot is baked clay; 111 and he stands more erect on that one than on the other.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 112 Pub tra, mes an our, yth yw torrys 113 gans un fendor a dhyrra dewdh, 114 hag ena, pub kymmerys, a wra henna ogof.
